entities.description: "The New York Times Company is the publisher of the newspaper, as indicated by the copyright notice and the article's presentation."
"Former President Donald J. Trump is central to the ballot case being ruled on by the Supreme Court, concerning his eligibility for the Colorado Republican primary ballot."
"The Supreme Court is deciding on the eligibility of Donald J. Trump for the Colorado primary ballot and potentially his eligibility to run in the general election and hold office."
"Colorado is significant as the state whose court declared Trump ineligible for the primary ballot due to insurrection in his efforts to subvert the 2020 election."
"George W. Bush is mentioned in the context of the Supreme Court's previous pivotal role in an election, with the decision in Bush v. Gore that handed him the presidency."
"The Colorado Republican Party urged the Supreme Court to rule on Trump's eligibility by March 5, when primaries are held in many states, including Colorado."
"Wayne LaPierre is the longtime chief of the National Rifle Association who announced his resignation on the eve of a legal battle in New York."
"The National Rifle Association, once a prominent lobbying organization, is facing a corruption trial in Manhattan with New York's attorney general, Letitia James."
"Letitia James is the attorney general of New York who is involved in a legal showdown with the National Rifle Association and Wayne LaPierre."
"Andrew Arulanandam is Wayne LaPierre's longtime spokesman who will become the NRA's interim chief executive."
"President Biden is under pressure to address the record numbers of migrants crossing into the United States, facing criticism from both Republican critics and Democratic mayors and governors."
"Mike Johnston is the Democratic mayor of Denver, who describes the situation with migrants as both a humanitarian and fiscal crisis."

"Boston is mentioned as a city where migrants have camped out at the airport, indicating the impact of the migrant crisis."
"New York is highlighted for having more than 164,500 migrants in shelters since April 2022, with many still living in hotels, converted office buildings, or tent camps."
"Bush v. Gore is a landmark Supreme Court case that decided the 2000 U.S. presidential election, serving as a comparison for the current pivotal role of the court in the Trump case."
"Manhattan is the location where Wayne LaPierre is facing a corruption trial, indicating the significance of this legal battle for the National Rifle Association."
"The Republican primary is the election process where Donald J. Trump's eligibility is being contested by the Supreme Court, with implications for the general election."
"The 2020 election is referenced as the context in which Donald J. Trump is accused of insurrection by Colorado's top court, affecting his eligibility for future elections."
